plumetrack.gui package¶

Submodules¶

plumetrack.gui.artwork module¶

class plumetrack.gui.artwork.PlumetrackArtProvider[source]¶

Bases: wx._misc.ArtProvider

Customised art provider class for serving the Plumetrack specific icons.

CreateBitmap(artid, client, size)[source]¶

Overrides CreateBitmap from wx.ArtProvider. This method looks in the Plumetrack icons directory (as returned by plumetrack.get_plumetrack_icons_dir()) for the icon specified by artid. The icons are split up into subfolders by size (for example “16x16”) and this method will only look in the relevant size subfolder for the requested icon.

Bases: wx._controls.TextCtrl, plumetrack.gui.main.AutoUpdate

SetValue(val)[source]¶

Override the base class method so that using SetValue does not make the control think that something has changed. Otherwise newly loaded config files will look as though they need to be saved before they are edited.

class plumetrack.gui.main.MainFrame[source]¶

Bases: wx._windows.Frame

Main frame of the configuration utility GUI.

get_configs()[source]¶
launch(prev_cfg_file)[source]¶

Create all the GUI elements and show the main window. Note that this needs to be separate from the __init__ method, since we need to set the top level window for wx before calling launch().

on_cancel(evnt)[source]¶

Event handler for cancel button events. Exits the program.

on_close(evnt)[source]¶

Event handler for close events - exits the program.

on_config_change()[source]¶
on_interactive_viewer(evnt)[source]¶

Event handler for interactive toolbar events. Opens a directory choice dialog to choose an image directory to test the configs on and then launches a interactive_viewer_frame. Note that if a config test frame already exists then clicking test simply updates the configuration that the config test frame is displaying

on_new(evnt)[source]¶
on_open_file(evnt)[source]¶
on_process(evnt)[source]¶

Event handler for batch process toolbar events. Opens the batch processing dialog

on_save(evnt)[source]¶

Event handler for Save button events. Opens a file selection dialog, reads the configs from the various panels and saves them to the selected file.

on_saveas(evnt)[source]¶
